definition: spearhead/barb/an attack or criticism
spear/lance/pike
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to target sb or sth (for attack, criticism etc)

sentences.english: Subsequent press reports named Bernard as the ambassador responsible.
sentences.chinese: 随后更有媒体报道将矛头直指贝纳德大使。

sentences.english: I like Spearhead and the Beastie Boys.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢矛头跟《野兽男孩》。

sentences.english: Sloth turneth the bend of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰能磨去才智的矛头。

sentences.english: Almost immediately, several blamed traditional arch-enemy Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 矛头几乎立刻就指向了印度的宿敌巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: Sloth tarnishes the edge of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懒散能磨去才智的矛头。

sentences.english: But much of the venom in the press, at any rate, is directed at big multinationals.
sentences.chinese: 然，媒体的许多恶意中伤，矛头直指大的跨国公司。

sentences.english: And then I directed the spearhead at mother, "You are also so fat.
sentences.chinese: 然后我把矛头指向妈妈，“你也很胖。

sentences.english: This month the campaign turned more personal.
sentences.chinese: 这个月，这场运动将矛头指向了个人。

sentences.english: The movement is not anti-business or anti-capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 其矛头所向并非企业或资本主义。

sentences.english: Bazin is the main point of criticism directed Eisenstein and Pudovkin's.
sentences.chinese: 巴赞批评的矛头主要是指向爱森斯坦和普多夫金的。

sentences.english: Both direct volleys of abuse at Mr Bush.
sentences.chinese: 两人都将漫骂的矛头指向布什先生。
这矛头引出了许多问题。

sentences.english: The father continues to blame the CDC for trying to dodge the responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 男童父亲仍将矛头指向疾管局，要他们别规避责任。

sentences.english: They take a big shot at those corrupted officials.
sentences.chinese: 他们把矛头直接对准了腐败的官吏。

sentences.english: This is the new American world of the Clovis points.
sentences.chinese: 这就是克洛维斯矛头出现的美洲新世界。

sentences.english: This time the main targets come from China, the rising power to the south.
sentences.chinese: 这一次他们将矛头直指中国，这个南部崛起的新势力。

definition: to target sb or sth (for attack, criticism etc)
to point towards/aimed at/facing/the direction indicated
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to attack (verbally or in writing)
to denounce/to condemn
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
public opinion
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to criticize/criticism/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
to vilify sb wantonly/unrestrained attack (on sb)
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
to angrily rebuke/to indignantly denounce
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
